comments: Counter- Strike: Global Offensive is probably the most popular multiplayer game on PC at the moment, along with last year's Overwatch. What Valve has done with this game, is pretty much take the original Counter Strike, polish and polish it up, add some new features, and release it as this new game. Which is frankly quite disappointing. Valve could've gone all out with this game, create aCounter- Strike: Global Offensive is probably the most popular multiplayer game on PC at the moment, along with last year's Overwatch. What Valve has done with this game, is pretty much take the original Counter Strike, polish and polish it up, add some new features, and release it as this new game. Which is frankly quite disappointing. Valve could've gone all out with this game, create a true and genuine evolution from CS1. But alas, they make this. This is not a bad game, it is very polished, the sound design is on point, and the graphics are solid, but this wasn't the evolution that the Counter Strike franchise needed.… Expand

comments: As someone who played 1.6 and Source, although it does not trigger nostalgia like its predecessors, CS:GO is a great game. CS:GO is an action and strategy game. Mechanically, CS:GO is a multiplayer first-person shooter (FPS). The main game of Counter-Strike: Global Offensive pits two teams, terrorists and counter-terrorists, against each other. To win, the terrorists have two winAs someone who played 1.6 and Source, although it does not trigger nostalgia like its predecessors, CS:GO is a great game. CS:GO is an action and strategy game. Mechanically, CS:GO is a multiplayer first-person shooter (FPS). The main game of Counter-Strike: Global Offensive pits two teams, terrorists and counter-terrorists, against each other. To win, the terrorists have two win conditions: plant the bomb at one of two bombsites and successfully detonate it or kill all of the counter-terrorists. Conversely, the counter-terrorists have three win conditions: defuse the planted bomb, kill all of the terrorists, or the timer ends before the terrorists meet one of their win conditions. The first team to meet their win condition wins the round. Each round is one minute and 45 seconds. Teams switch sides (terrorists switch to counter-terrorist side, and vice versa) after 15 rounds. The first team to win 16 rounds out of 30 wins the game. If the score reaches 15-15, the game ends in a draw, unless you are playing on non-Valve servers where a 15-15 scoreline may lead to an overtime. CS:GO has many weapons used for different situations depending on what weapons the other team has, economic status, and strategy. A variety of grenades can be used to gain an advantage such as decoys, smoke grenades, and flashbangs. These grenades are critical in developing strategies. Although the gameplay described in the previous paragraph is not all there is to CS:GO. With the Steam Workshop, there are an enormous number of user-generated maps and game modes. All of these are hosted on community servers. From surf, to bunnyhop, to gun-game, there are many different ways to enjoy CS:GO. In addition to the game itself, CS:GO’s esports scene also provides value. With fast-paced action and easy to understand gameplay, CS:GO is one of the best spectator esports. In 2013, Valve introduced the “majors”, which were Valve-sponsored tournaments for CS:GO with prize pools of $250,000, eventually becoming $1 million in 2016. Valve’s continued support for the esports scene brought it to the forefront of esports. ELEAGUE, a CS:GO league created and televised by TBS, debuted in 2016. CS:GO broke the Twitch record for single channel peak concurrent streams during the grand finals of the ELEAGUE Major: Boston 2018 with a total of 1.1 million concurrent viewers. Personally going to events like iBUYPOWER Masters and Dreamhack Austin, if you really love the game, the adrenaline and excitement is well worth the money of these events. With all of these factors, CS:GO has risen to the top ranks of esports. Visually, CS:GO aims for a realistic look. Maps in CS:GO explore many different environments from a nuclear power plant to a German castle. Weapons in CS:GO are based on real military/police weapons such as the AK-47, Desert Eagle, and Glock. Counter-terrorist character models are based on real counter-terrorist forces, such as GIGN, SAS, and SWAT. The audio for CS:GO follows the realistic theme. Gun and grenade noises are based on their real-life counterparts. Music in CS:GO are drum-heavy and with brass instruments, contributing to a military aesthetic. From my own experience in meeting players and playing matchmaking, most players are male. Males represent a majority of professional CS:GO players. If you do play the competitive mode, I recommend ranking up so that you can have “Prime Matchmaking” which greatly reduces the chances of being matched with cheaters or toxic players, allowing for a much better experience. CS:GO, being a multiplayer-only video game, lacks what is traditionally considered a narrative. There are no “story levels”, plot, nor characters in the traditional sense. Nobody would call CS:GO a narrative video game. However, with players as the cast of characters, maps as settings, and player actions forming the plot, there is a narrative to be told with every match of CS:GO. Given the type of game CS:GO is, there are risks associated with playing it. CS:GO is typically viewed as a “violent video game”, that moniker carries with it stigma of causing aggressive behavior. With recent news stories about esports gambling, CS:GO is a prime target for accusations of fostering underaged gambling and gambling addiction. I do not believe that CS:GO, or any video game for that matter, makes people more aggressive but I do believe CS:GO can be a gateway into gambling With all of these facets, CS:GO has a very broad appeal. Whether you play games casually, competitively, enjoy watching esports, developing maps, or dabbling in some “healthy” gambling, CS:GO has a lot to offer. At a price point of $15, dropping even lower during Steam sales, CS:GO is easily worth its asking price.… Expand

Flashing for teammates, trade killing, and smoke line-ups bring a full multiplayer experience with a bunch of depth for however far a player wants toNo other first person shooter brings the reward that counter strike brings. The movement and aiming are in my eyes define it as the ultimate competitive shooter. Every duel is interesting, with further complexity when you factor in teamwork. Flashing for teammates, trade killing, and smoke line-ups bring a full multiplayer experience with a bunch of depth for however far a player wants to go with the game. The economy system further allows for strategy: do you want that smoke grenade or a helmet? Do you risk buying a pistol this round so you cant buy a full utility the next round? All this makes an engaging experience. A 2 minute round timer ensures that players are regularly aggressive and encourages to take bomb sites by force. This also makes the game more engaging as a spectator experience compared to the contrastingly defensive mobas and battle royale games.… Expand

comments: I only have 261 hours on this game, so I'm not great at it. (That's not a joke by the way). This game is amazing for a competitive experience. CS:GO combines solid gameplay with a tactical, team based environment and stellar, balanced maps. CS:GO has competitive skill groups, ranging from throwers and bad players down in the low Silver ranks, and the best players in the world at theI only have 261 hours on this game, so I'm not great at it. (That's not a joke by the way). This game is amazing for a competitive experience. CS:GO combines solid gameplay with a tactical, team based environment and stellar, balanced maps. CS:GO has competitive skill groups, ranging from throwers and bad players down in the low Silver ranks, and the best players in the world at the highest ranks (Supreme Master First Class and The Global Elite). This game is the example of what a hardcore, top-tier skill ceiling, eSports-level competitive game should look like. The lowest level of members on tier-2 teams are incredibly gifted individuals with thousands of hours poured into the game. The gameplay is balanced, marginal luck is involved, it doesn't have micro-transactions that influence gameplay. It is the top FPS eSport (if you don't count Fortnite or PUBG, both of which are dying games and are not first-person-shooters) and (now) has more and more players coming back to play it. CSGO as a casual game was in its prime in 2016, but CSGO as a competitive game is at an all time high. If you're not into competitive shooters, then CSGO is not the game for you. However, if you are, it DEFINITELY is.… Expand

comments: I am going to give you a detail review about Counter Strike: Global Offensive. Comparing to old versions of Cs, this one is a bit different. We have the whole new map pool, which based on the architecture of some old maps, but in the new level of graphic quality. Brand new Cs have a lot of things that Valve putted so much effort in, such as the new look for characters, new buy menuI am going to give you a detail review about Counter Strike: Global Offensive. Comparing to old versions of Cs, this one is a bit different. We have the whole new map pool, which based on the architecture of some old maps, but in the new level of graphic quality. Brand new Cs have a lot of things that Valve putted so much effort in, such as the new look for characters, new buy menu with circle shape. Everything from old game have been replaced by a high quality objects. Smoke, flash and grenade have been changed with a new look, more realistic. As usually, all the idea about maps, characters and guns are based on real life destination, real things and people. Texture, effect and sound are better than the old versions. In my opinion, I feel it easier to hear the sound of grenade when it came out, more clearly footsteps. Gameplay is really good, for people love Cs they will feel amazing when the gameplay do not have much change and they can easy to play as they used to do with the old version. They added more mode such as demolistion and arm race, more relaxing mode for online player to relax after ranking game. Brand new ranks for Csgo was created. You need to have 10 win games to display your skill rank, I think this rank system used to be very good when it is very accurate. But in 2018, match making systems are so bad, one because of hacking issue, two is about how system arrange group of people. Voice chat also on the game, make people can communicate better. The most developed thing is multiplayer. In 2018, Csgo is one of the best eSports game of all time with nearly 300 tournaments in 1 year. Price pool for 1 officially tournament is up to 150.000$. A lot of people contributed to make this game become a way better than other eSports game. I can say football and CSGO nowadays have the same industry, when they paid professional player and teams very good salary. Some people change their life when they play CSGO. Football have bet systems, CSGO also. Football have manager and sponsor, CSGO have it too. When talking about CSGO, they put more attention on how CSGO change life, lots people don’t care about gameplay and error or issues of the game, they are still play it for better ranked and some for money. Valve also just give CSGO less effort. Even there was a lot of issue but most of pro team still training it every day, from that we can know how CSGO change people life, make it become a real job . Overall, CSGO is not just a game, it is life for lots of people. Valve have created a good game, nice changed from older version that still make CS lover want to purchase. How Valve run their CS community actually make me impresss.… Expand
author: Duc

comments: I **** love this game! But it's still far from a perfect game. it has some flaws. while some can be seen trough, most of them really affect the gameplay. For example, there is no real sense of progression in the game besides a ranking system only meant to match you with players of matching your skill levels. Which can be exploited by so-called "smurfs". These smurfs are highlyI **** love this game! But it's still far from a perfect game. it has some flaws. while some can be seen trough, most of them really affect the gameplay. For example, there is no real sense of progression in the game besides a ranking system only meant to match you with players of matching your skill levels. Which can be exploited by so-called "smurfs". These smurfs are highly skilled players that try to get a low rank ( often on a second account). The game will then match them with people with that low rank. I haven't encountered a lot of smurfs, maybe like 2 or 3 in my 500 hours playing this game. (at least that I remember) but a lot of people are reporting problems about this issue. Another thing is that it seems ( at least to me ) that Valve is far more eager to create new loot boxes/ crates for the game instead of actual new content. If you could compare how many times a skin related update or a gameplay related update got released. There would be alot more skin related. The anti-cheat of this game sometimes seems non-existent. The game has a HUGE cheater community. Even youtubers that make videos only about their new cheats etc. the game is full of 'em. That doesn't mean Valve hasn't come up with something to go against this problem. "Prime matchmaking" is what its called. What it will do is match you against other players with this option turned on. the catch is you can immediately turn this option on. you have to have a lot of hours and experience with the game before the option granted to you. which makes new innocent players vulnerable.. Now let's get to why I love this game! The intensity, the competitive feeling I just love it! sometimes you go full tactical mode with your friends calling out everything you see. and sometimes you will just buy the **** SMG in the game and rush the enemy team hoping for a win. it's just a lot of fun. The amount of fun you will be having will be determined by how seriously you will take the game. if you can't stand to lose. stay far FAR away from this game. This game's community can vary a lot from where you're located. At least for me, they haven't been too toxic. Some bad apples but you'll find that in any game. So a short summary: + Awesome gameplay + Great maps - No real progression - Greedy Valve - Unfair/ Unbalanced matches… Expand

comments: Counter Strike: Global Offensive is a great and competitively viable first person shooter, produced and published by Valve software. Counter Strike's main competitive mode is fought between two teams, counter terrorists and terrorists. The terrorist's goal is to fight their way to a bombsite and plant an explosive with a 40 second timer, while the counter terrorists team must reach, andCounter Strike: Global Offensive is a great and competitively viable first person shooter, produced and published by Valve software. Counter Strike's main competitive mode is fought between two teams, counter terrorists and terrorists. The terrorist's goal is to fight their way to a bombsite and plant an explosive with a 40 second timer, while the counter terrorists team must reach, and defuse the explosive. The team's consist of five different players and each player, in a well structured team, takes on a certain role. However, Counter Strike is not only popular for it's competitive modes, but also for it's casual modes such as team death-match, demolition and arms race. Counter Strike has a very active developer team and receives regular content updates as well as frequent bug fixes to keep the game running smoothly. All-in-all, Counter Strike has remained to popular, and as one of Valves largest titles, for a reason. It is competitive, but knows how to provide casual players with a unique and fun experience.… Expand

comments: Not the best installment in the series, but the most popular. There are reasons for the Global Offensive popularity - 1. Steam got more popular 2. Player base is getting stronger each year 3. This game is overhyped by YouTube, Twitch and other internet sources. But the game itself is no better than Counter-Strike Source, which is really disappointing, considering that GO was released inNot the best installment in the series, but the most popular. There are reasons for the Global Offensive popularity - 1. Steam got more popular 2. Player base is getting stronger each year 3. This game is overhyped by YouTube, Twitch and other internet sources. But the game itself is no better than Counter-Strike Source, which is really disappointing, considering that GO was released in 2012, 8 (!) years after CS Source, but didn't bring much improvement, aside from some weapons, game modes, and other small features. But the maps, gameplay, and even graphics didn't really change much, compare to Source. In late 2018, a lot of problems only got worse, the main problems are: 1. Cheaters. VAC is trying to fight them, but not to a needed extent. And there are A LOT of cheaters nowadays, because the game became freemium2. Toxic community. GO is the part of the series with the most toxic community I've encountered in all CS games. Not everyone is bad, but you will find a lot of toxic players 3. Shady gambling and trading schemes 4. Extensive monetization So the game now is worse than is was in 2013-2014, and due to freemium mode all listed and other problems in the game will only get worse. I hope Valve will do something about it, before it's too late.… Expand

The skill-cap on this game is very high and I respect people which have put their dedication into mastering this game. The problem with it in my book is that the game is too unforgiving. I know that being unforgiving is a very appealing trait for a lot of people, but I think it's just not what I seek in my games. I like having brutal mechanics in single-player games more, as in that scenario the blame can not be put on your teammates, but on the game. The brutal unforgiving nature of CS:GO unfortunately just makes the entire community a toxic crater of cancer, which makes it only really fun to play with a 5-man. author: Walsh

comments: [Posted December 3, 2014] I must recommend this game, it is my duty as one who has spent 1600 hours on CSS (from xFire) and 500+ hours on CSGO. I played non-stop competitive CS:Source in regional championships, LANs, and online leagues; and won 4 regional championships with some LAN placings. Here's what I have to say about GO... CSGO is awesome, Valve delivered here in the end. When[Posted December 3, 2014] I must recommend this game, it is my duty as one who has spent 1600 hours on CSS (from xFire) and 500+ hours on CSGO. I played non-stop competitive CS:Source in regional championships, LANs, and online leagues; and won 4 regional championships with some LAN placings. Here's what I have to say about GO... CSGO is awesome, Valve delivered here in the end. When it was released, yeah, it wasn't anything special, just a pretty CS:Source. But now we have amazing gun skins, stickers, awesome knives, intense major tournaments, souvenir packages, bracket prediction challenges, seasonal operations with extra maps and challenges for even more drops, etc. It's awesome, it's a great game to be a part of. Matchmaking and rated matchmaking based personal ELO rankings is a sweet way to keep competitive games close. It can never be perfect, but back in Source you had to wait in an IRC channel with a looped message playing until someone finally answered your loop and then it took them 20 minutes to get 5 in the server, etc. Basically with CS:Source whether you were trying to ring or you had your team it took between 20-60 minutes to get a scrim. Now it takes about 5. So, the fact that people still complain about it is beyond me. Game play wise, each CS as I know them (1.6, Source, GO) has been different beasts in terms of mechanics and recoil control. Lots of little things that made or broke you as a player in these games, but recoil control is one of the biggest. You often hear people scream “deathmatch deathmatch deathmatch, that's the only way to get better”. Well, quick point, how can you DM to practice when you don't know what your practicing? Best thing to do to understand the recoil patterns is load an offline game, kick the bots, and shoot at walls. Seriously. Shoot and spray at walls with various guns at various ranges with various movement patterns, that's the best way to understand how to control and use various guns. You need to understand each guns grouping patterns first before you can practice controlling them! About the community, yes, the flamers and trolls are alive and well. But here's the thing, I've been around CS a long time, I've won 4 regional championships with CS:Source, and really it never bothered me that sometimes the flamers are all you hear. Here's why. Once you play enough games (competitive or otherwise) you'll hear the same kind of person, it'll sound like this.. “you guys suck, why are you even playing this game?” or something similar if they are beating you. It sounds like this, “you're such a hacker, it's so obvious” when you beat them. The fact that people are so binary in their mentality amuses me personally, so I carry that over to CS flamers as well. Some people like to pretend they are perfect at the game, and everyone else around them is inferior, yet if you beat them you must be a hacker. It just sounds so stupid to even talk about it but seriously this is how a lot of people are about the game. Just don't let it get to you, there's no point. Don't even engage. And you wont have many problems. It's not the easiest game to pick up right off the bat. “Spray at feet, get headshot” is a notorious saying from outsiders about CS games, because CS can be amazingly random sometimes. And the round-by-round economy, buying guns and items every round, and recoil patterns make it a steep learning curve. But if you understand the groupings (I said how to above), read guides about strategy (like economy management, game flow), and just get in there and start playing you will see why people just can't stop playing this game! Counter-Strike was the world's original eSport. After the Championship Gaming Series went down the CS1.6 and CS:Source attention did as well, games like StarCraft and DOTA took to the forefront of competitive eSports soon after. But with the cases, skins, and major tournaments Valve and the CS community have turned CS:GO back into one of the world's premiere eSports and there's many, many reasons why it's succeeding. As I say, it's a very exciting game to be a part of right now.… Expand
author: blutank24

comments: Counter-Strike is a game with great potential but a terrible realization. Let's have a look at game's gameplay. Such a simple and uncomplicated idea developed dozens of years ago became an obsession for thousands. This game series would be immortal if developers had more attention and enthusiasm. But the don't. Instead of making a great anti-cheat, releasing regular updates and adequateCounter-Strike is a game with great potential but a terrible realization. Let's have a look at game's gameplay. Such a simple and uncomplicated idea developed dozens of years ago became an obsession for thousands. This game series would be immortal if developers had more attention and enthusiasm. But the don't. Instead of making a great anti-cheat, releasing regular updates and adequate cybersport supporting (making Internationals, etc.), Valve became passive in the game's life. And now this game is full of hackers and bugs and CS:GO majors are very unimpressive in comparison with Dota 2. comments: The game-play mechanics and the play style are good, but may take some time to understand properly(use and know how to exploit). The best bit of this game, is the speed of engagement which results in very quick and tense confrontations, where often, a burst of fire ends in a winner, and tactics CAN help dramatically. The noise of your opponents(So turn off music and get decent headThe game-play mechanics and the play style are good, but may take some time to understand properly(use and know how to exploit). The best bit of this game, is the speed of engagement which results in very quick and tense confrontations, where often, a burst of fire ends in a winner, and tactics CAN help dramatically. The noise of your opponents(So turn off music and get decent head phones!) and the way various other aspects of the game work such as random scatter (aim) and grenades do compliment the game VERY WELL. If you know what your doing, you can use grenades to get through impossible situations or out-gun 5 people if your good enough. However, random aim can leave you feeling miserable sometimes, even with burst control... Generally the options for the guns are good... though it ain't Killing floor... see below CSGO is good, as mentioned make no mistake, however you need to take the following caveats into account that can make your game time MISERABLE - not unlike playing L4D2 on PvP. ( I think maybe why they sell prime match making nowadays LOL - but well this is FTP, so give em money for a decent game ) As the devs have corrected the 2 bottom points which are dev related, I will vote this up - but this still has issues with IZI / EZ noobs as described above. ( did not recommend this from my 500-1000 hours playing) I may have recommened this, but the issues below are a big deal and will STILL be a source of MISERY. ------------------------------------------- Details of the Woes of Misery: -Community of desperate to win players : NO SPORTSMAN-SHIP -Who SPAM HIGH END GUNS like: awp/XM1014/sgg58(Aug)(scope)/p90/SCAR CONSTANTLY ( the game does not really BALANCE to prevent it) -Who join games in GROUPS,ARTIFICIALLY LOSE for half the session and then brutally destroy the enemy team in the next 6 rounds – making UNFIXABLE BALANCE - this creates a cheesey un fun game and is pure misery. rejoning often takes you back to the same server... (keep leaving and rejoining may fix this) -The BAD BALANCE of the guns - money, even in casual doesn't restrict over use of high-end guns... -CHEESEY RANDOM AIM that allows people to hit you when they are not aiming at you. -Some guns have NO RANGE RESTRICTIONS - So get ready to be killed by an auto shotgun at range - although this emphasises the need for quick aiming (and luck ) to get head-shots (which stresses how game changing random aim becomes)(hence why the XM1014 is such an awful gun - it scatters so badly that you don't need to aim with it - and it fires in semi-auto mode D: ) Other minor issues -Arrangement and treating of less played maps putting newer or less played maps with maps like 'Mirage' and suggesting people don't want to play them(*sic). Most people just vote for 'Mirage' all the time... good thing you didn't add a replay map option to most votes :P NOTE : YOu can play these maps and many others on the custom servers - these maps will be rare on official servers as mentioned -which is a shame. No longer an issue?: revoked point : removal and simplification of maps i.e. Nuke and other maps were recently simplified... Why? : The updates are good, and new maps and updates are welcome. revoked point : Presence of an account analytical matchmaker system that I cannot get out of WHY? this was the case 2 years ago, but I have noticed prime matchmaking is a paid for update. So feel free to spend for this privilege - I'm not sure if it applies any more - so dont hold me to it - please leave comment if I'm wrong! I will correct!… Expand

comments: In itself just one of the best shooting games ever. But until today Valve has not been able to do anything against the cheaters. And these run through the whole game, and in matchmaking you can often find cheaters. In addition, the whole Lagger came a while ago when it was decided to let other regions play with Europe (Russia, Saudi Arabia, parts of Asia etc.) Everyone should beIn itself just one of the best shooting games ever. But until today Valve has not been able to do anything against the cheaters. And these run through the whole game, and in matchmaking you can often find cheaters. In addition, the whole Lagger came a while ago when it was decided to let other regions play with Europe (Russia, Saudi Arabia, parts of Asia etc.) Everyone should be aware that due to the distance and the possibly poor internet connection, Laggs will occur anyway. And in games like CS: GO, Laggs = Cheats because depending on how strong an opponent is, they can not be hit and have clear advantages. But only money counts here, as long as players spend money on CS: GO Valve doesn't really care. For these reasons I can not recommend the game to anyone who does not like to play with cheaters and camps. If you don't care, CS: GO is a really good balanced (tactical) shooter.… Expand

comments: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is one of the best Free 2 Play Competitive Shooters I have played in recent years. Its clean, non pay2win gun play is easy to learn hard to master, and its maps are high polished, nice looking classics that shaped the way shooters design their levels to this day. The games competitive scene is also one of the biggest in the industry which helps to bringCounter-Strike: Global Offensive is one of the best Free 2 Play Competitive Shooters I have played in recent years. Its clean, non pay2win gun play is easy to learn hard to master, and its maps are high polished, nice looking classics that shaped the way shooters design their levels to this day. The games competitive scene is also one of the biggest in the industry which helps to bring CS:GO's player numbers to astronomical levels. (its not uncommon to see player numbers between 800 and 990 thousand players online at the same time) in terms of gamemodes CS:GO offers a wide range of modes, which, while fairly common, do provide a nice alternative to CS:GOs lifeblood: The Competitive 5v5 Ranked mode.… Expand

comments: Unfortunately this game is very hard to get into based on how many cheaters there are because whether you like it or not Valve segregates players using trust factor and prime matchmaking personally I have had a great experience playing the game, and while the graphics are outdated the game play is highly addictive I have played 1600 hours over the past three years and am still not boredUnfortunately this game is very hard to get into based on how many cheaters there are because whether you like it or not Valve segregates players using trust factor and prime matchmaking personally I have had a great experience playing the game, and while the graphics are outdated the game play is highly addictive I have played 1600 hours over the past three years and am still not bored and play almost everyday I have encountered cheaters, but they are few and far between and in my experience they get banned by overwatch. Also all the lootboxes are cosmetic, and you can buy them on a marketplace. This game also has a massive economy which you can invest in like a stock market. I bought 30 breakout cases for 6 cents each and then sold them later for 70 cents each. I have met a lot of "nice" people in the game along with some toxic people, but generally you friend a few hundred "nice" people and can get at least one person to play with whenever you want. I don't know why, but this game has a replayable magic to it, and the game is far from dead.… Expand
